abstract: European leaders are confronted with challenge of routing out Islamic State fighters who have embedded themselves in their major cities in wake of terrorist attacks on Paris and Brussels; experts say countries will need to develop strategies to address underlying conditions that lead many of their citizens down path to radicalization, in addition to bolstering their intelligence and security operations.
lead_paragraph: For European leaders, who see themselves as at war with the Islamic State, the problem is that the enemy’s hide-outs are not in a faraway failed state.

headline.main: A Quandary for Europe: Fighting a War on ISIS Within Its Borders
headline.print_headline: Europe Faces Challenge of Fighting ISIS Within Its Borders

snippet: For European leaders, who see themselves as at war with the Islamic State, the problem is that the enemy’s hide-outs are not in a faraway failed state.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
